column1: wide down the leg side to begin the spell
fuller ball outside the off stump. He looks to steer it away but gets an inside-edge to short fine-leg
sweeps it to square-leg
comes down the track and pushes it to midwicket for a single

and he gets Short with the first ball that he bowls to him! He comes forward to a ball pitched on the middle stump. It hits him above the knee roll. There is an appeal and the umpire raises his finger. Short isn't happy as he feels it might have bounced over the stumps. Spin is a weakness for Short and news of weakness travels pretty fast in Franchise cricket
looks to cut it and is beaten
flicks it to midwicket for a single
cuts it to point
on the leg stump. He turns it comfortably to square-leg for a single
defends it to the off side
short outside the off stump. Bailey spots it and does the Natraj shot ala Kapil Dev to guide it to fine-leg for a couple
short outside the off stump and probably a touch faster than the previous ball as Bailey is hurried into the stroke. He pulls it to square-leg to retain the strike with a single
fuller and flighted outside the off stump. He skips down the track and lofts it to wide long-off for a couple
punches it to mid-on for a single
comes forward and turns it to long-on for a couple
Bailey doesn't want Dunk to settle down. He skips down the track and drives it straight back down the ground for a boundary
gives the ball some air outside the off stump. Bailey notices it early and gets to the pitch of the delivery as he lofts it over wide long-off for the first six of the innings
defends it back to the bowler
Coleman begins his spell with a wide down the leg side
and for good measure, repeats the line from previous ball
over-compensates and bowls one wide outside the off stump
bowls a straight ball finally and Wade glances it to fine-leg where Worall lets the ball through his legs for a boundary
defends it to the leg side for a single
fuller ball outside the off stump. He comes forward and drills a drive to mid-off
width outside the off stump. Bailey opens the face of the bat and square-drives it in the gap at point for a boundary.
short ball outside the off stump. He comes forward and pulls it to deeo midwicket for a boundary. You can't set a field for such shots
on the leg stump. He glances it to fine-leg for a boundary
defends it to the off side for a single
comes forward and defends it to the off side
drives it to deep point and takes a couple easily
short  ball outside the off stump. He drag-flicks it to wide long-on for a couple

and the Bailey Show comes to an end! Short and wide outside the off stump. Bread and Butter. Daal baath as people in Bangladesh love to call it. Bailey goes for the cut and doesn't get elevation on it as he cuts it to point. Worall doesn't let this one pass
short and wide outside the off stump. Wade cuts it to point for a boundary

another short ball outside the off stump. Not as wide as the previous ball, but closer to the off stump. Wade decides to go for the pull and doesn't play it well enough. He top-edges the pull to midwicket where Gotch takes the catch
defends it to the off side
short ball outside the off stump. He stands tall and rides the bounce as he guides it to point
slower ball outside the off stump. He doesn't find a way past the point fielder ... yet
comes forward and defends it to the off side
cuts it to point for a single
comes forward and unveils the silkiest of drives through cover for a boundary
defends it to the off side
comes forward and defends it to the off side

dropped! fuller ball outside the off stump. Christian wanted to send this ball to the Rod Laver Arena as he went for the almighty slog. He manages a top-edge that Gulbis calls for. He pedals back and isn't anywhere near the ball as he drops it

short ball outside the off stump. He slices it past point to seal the victory. What a farewell to KP and Quiney. Hobart Hurricanes will have to wait on the result for the evening game to know if they reach semis or not
